name: Summer in the city
desc: Just a beautiful and warm summer day, full of sun and joy

name: Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco, California, USA
desc: The Golden Gate Bridge is a suspension bridge spanning the Golden Gate strait, the one-mile-wide, three-mile-long channel between San Francisco Bay and the Pacific Ocean.

name: Coliseum during sunset in Rome Italy
desc: The Colosseum or Coliseum, also known as the Flavian Amphitheatre or Colosseo, is an oval amphitheatre in the centre of the city of Rome, Italy.

name: Como Lake, Milan, Italy, on sunset with Alps mountains
desc: Lake Como or locally in Italian, also known as Lario, is a lake of glacial origin in Lombardy, Italy.

name: Christmas lantern with snowfall
desc: Christmas lights are lights used for decoration in preparation for Christmas and for display throughout Christmastide.

name: Fallen autumn leaves
desc: Autumn is one of the four temperate seasons. Autumn marks the transition from summer into winter, in September or March, when the arrival of night becomes noticeably earlier and the temperature cools considerably.

name: Mediterranean sea at sunrise, small old town and yacht
desc: Camogli is a fishing village and tourist resort located on the west side of the peninsula of Portofino, on the Golfo Paradiso at the Riviera di Levante, in the Metropolitan City of Genoa, Liguria, northern Italy.

name: Black stones
desc: Black stones on sea side during sunny day

name: Closeup of dandelion
desc: A dandelion is a flower. Its scientific name is Taraxacum, a large genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. They are native to Eurasia and North and South America.

name: Fantastic evening winter landscape
desc: Winter is the coldest season of the year in polar and temperate climates, between autumn and spring. Winter is caused by the axis of the Earth in that hemisphere being oriented away from the Sun.

name: Grand Canal and Basilica Santa Maria della Salute
desc: Santa Maria della Salute, commonly known simply as the Salute, is a Roman Catholic church and minor basilica located at Punta della Dogana in the Dorsoduro sestiere of the city of Venice, Italy.

name: View of Bogliasco
desc: Bogliasco is a comune in the Province of Genoa in the Italian region Liguria, located about 11 kilometres southeast of Genoa.

name: Grand canale from Rialto Bridge at blue hour
desc: The Grand Canal is a canal in Venice, Italy. It forms one of the major water-traffic corridors in the city. Public transport is provided by water buses and private water taxis, and many tourists explore the canal by gondola.

name: Coast of Piano di Sorrento
desc: Piano di Sorrento is a comune in the Metropolitan City of Naples in the Italian region Campania, located about 25 km southeast of Naples.

name: Tuscany, rural sunset landscape
desc: Tuscany is a region in central Italy with an area of about 23,000 square kilometres and a population of about 3.8 million inhabitants (2013). The regional capital is Florence.

name: Saint Angel Castle and bridge over the Tiber river in Rome
desc: The Mausoleum of Hadrian, usually known as Castel Sant'Angelo, is a towering cylindrical building in Parco Adriano, Rome, Italy.

name: Eiffel tower, Paris. France
desc: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France. It is named after the engineer Gustave Eiffel, whose company designed and built the tower.

name: Pont Alexandre III
desc: The Pont Alexandre III is a deck arch bridge that spans the Seine in Paris. It connects the Champs-Elysees quarter with those of the Invalides and Eiffel Tower. The bridge is widely regarded as the most ornate, extravagant bridge in the city. It is classified as a French Monument historique.

name: Arc de Triomphe Paris city at sunset
desc: The Arc de Triomphe de l'Etoile is one of the most famous monuments in Paris. It stands in the centre of the Place Charles de Gaulle, at the western end of the Champs-Elysees.

name: Stade de France view
desc: The Stade de France is the national stadium of France, just north of Paris in the commune of Saint-Denis. Its seating capacity of 81,338 makes it the sixth-largest stadium in Europe.

name: Place de la Bourse
desc: Place de la Bourse is one of the most recognizable sights of Bordeaux. Its architect was Ange-Jacques Gabriel. It was built from 1730 to 1775.

name: Saint Jean Castle and Cathedral de la Major and the Vieux port
desc: Marseille Cathedral is a Roman Catholic cathedral, and a national monument of France, located in Marseille. It has been a basilica minor since 1896. It is the seat of the Archdiocese of Marseille.

name: Pont du Gard
desc: The Pont du Gard is an ancient Roman aqueduct that crosses the Gardon River in southern France. Located near the town of Vers-Pont-du-Gard, the bridge is part of the Nimes aqueduct, a 50-kilometre system built in the first century AD to carry water from a spring at Uzes to the Roman colony of Nemausus.

name: The Louvre Museum
desc: The Louvre or the Louvre Museum is the world's largest museum and a historic monument in Paris, France.

name: Brandenburg gate of Berlin
desc: The Brandenburg Gate is an 18th-century neoclassical monument in Berlin, and one of the best-known landmarks of Germany. It is built on the site of a former city gate that marked the start of the road from Berlin to the town of Brandenburg an der Havel.

name: Rothenburg ob der Tauber
desc: Rothenburg ob der Tauber is a town in the district of Ansbach of Mittelfranken, the Franconia region of Bavaria, Germany. It is well known for its well-preserved medieval old town, a destination for tourists from around the world.

name: Beautiful winter wonderland mountain scenery in the Alps
desc: The Watzmann is a mountain in the Bavarian Alps south of the village of Berchtesgaden. It is the third highest in Germany, and the highest located entirely on German territory.

name: Rhododendron Park Kromlau
desc: The Azalea and Rhododendron Park Kromlau is a 200 acres landscaped park in the municipality of Gablenz, Saxony. It was built in the 19th century. The park has no entry fee and can be accessed any time. The famous Rakotzbrucke is a short walk from the free car parking area.

name: Beautiful view of the historic town of Rothenburg ob der Tauber
desc: Rothenburg ob der Tauber is a town in the district of Ansbach of Mittelfranken, the Franconia region of Bavaria, Germany. It is well known for its well-preserved medieval old town, a destination for tourists from around the world.

name: Neuschwanstein Castle in the Bavarian Alps of Germany
desc: Neuschwanstein Castle is a nineteenth-century Romanesque Revival palace on a rugged hill above the village of Hohenschwangau near Fussen in southwest Bavaria, Germany.

name: Navagio beach with shipwreck against sunset on Zakynthos island in Greece
desc: Navagio Beach, or Shipwreck Beach, is an exposed cove, sometimes referred to as "Smugglers Cove", on the coast of Zakynthos, in the Ionian Islands of Greece.

name: Parthenon temple on the Acropolis of Athens
desc: An acropolis is a settlement, especially a citadel, built upon an area of elevated groundï¿½frequently a hill with precipitous sides, chosen for purposes of defense.

name: Fishing boats at the coast of Crete
desc: The fishing industry has expanded and been modernized in recent years. In 2002, the Greek fishing fleet consisted of 19,504 vessels with 97,579 GRT, and there were 33,992 people employed in small scale fisheries.

name: Meteora - incredible sandstone rock formations
desc: The Meteora - is a formation of immense monolithic pillars and hills like huge rounded boulders dominate the local area.

name: Kleftiko, Milos island
desc: Milos or Melos is a volcanic Greek island in the Aegean Sea, just north of the Sea of Crete. Milos is the southwesternmost island in the Cyclades group.

name: Beach Navagio in Zakynthos
desc: Navagio Beach, or Shipwreck Beach, is an exposed cove, sometimes referred to as "Smugglers Cove", on the coast of Zakynthos, in the Ionian Islands of Greece. Navagio Beach was originally known as Agios Georgios.

name: River and sun rays in the Rodini Park.
desc: Rodini Park was probably the first landscaped park in the world. It was still popular with the Romans some years later and they left a bit of an aqueduct here. The park lies in a green and shady bed of a stream.

name: Beautiful sea landscapes on Zakynthos Island in Greece
desc: Zakynthos or Zante is a Greek island in the Ionian Sea. It is the third largest of the Ionian Islands. Zakynthos is a separate regional unit of the Ionian Islands region, and its only municipality.

name: Beautiful summer white Porto Katsiki beach on Ionian Sea Lefkada, Greece
desc: Porto Katsiki is a Beach on the Ionian Sea island of Lefkada. The name is said to be because formerly only goats could reach this area.

name: Windmills of Chios Island, Greece
desc: Chios is the fifth largest of the Greek islands, situated in the Aegean Sea, 7 kilometres off the Anatolian coast. The island is separated from Turkey by the Cesme Strait.

name: View on Peniscola from the top of Pope Luna's Castle
desc: Valencia, officially Valencia, is the capital of the autonomous community of Valencia and the third largest city in Spain after Madrid and Barcelona, with around 800,000 inhabitants in the administrative centre.

name: Windmills of Don Quixote
desc: Don Quixote, formerly, fully titled The Ingenious Gentleman Don Quixote of La Mancha, is a Spanish novel by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra. Published in two volumes, in 1605 and 1615, Don Quixote is considered the most influential work of literature from the Spanish Golden Age and the entire Spanish literary canon.

name: View of Basilica Pillar in Zaragoza
desc: Zaragoza, also called Saragossa in English, is the capital city of the Zaragoza province and of the autonomous community of Aragon, Spain. It lies by the Ebro river and its tributaries, the Huerva and the Gallego, roughly in the center of both Aragon and the Ebro basin.

name: Caucasus mountains in Georgia
desc: The Caucasus Mountains are a mountain system in Eurasia between the Black Sea and the Caspian Sea in the Caucasus region.

name: Reine Village, Lofoten Islands, Norway
desc: Reine is a fishing village and the administrative centre of the municipality of Moskenes in Nordland county, Norway. It is located on the island of Moskenesoya in the Lofoten archipelago, above the Arctic Circle, about 300 kilometres southwest of the town of Tromso.

name: Natural landscape at Geirangerfjord in Norway
desc: The Geiranger Fjord is a fjord in the Sunnmore region of More og Romsdal county, Norway. It is located entirely in the Stranda Municipality. It is a 15-kilometre long branch off of the Sunnylvsfjorden, which is a branch off of the Storfjorden.

name: Reindeers in natural environment
desc: The reindeer, also known as caribou in North America, is a species of deer with circumpolar distribution, native to Arctic, Subarctic, tundra, boreal and mountainous regions of northern Europe, Siberia, and North America. This includes both sedentary and migratory populations.

name: Mountains, Lofoten islands, Norway
desc: Lofoten is an archipelago and a traditional district in the county of Nordland, Norway. Lofoten is known for a distinctive scenery with dramatic mountains and peaks, open sea and sheltered bays, beaches and untouched lands.

name: Road in mountain, Lofoten islands, Norway
desc: Lofoten is an archipelago and a traditional district in the county of Nordland, Norway. Lofoten is known for a distinctive scenery with dramatic mountains and peaks, open sea and sheltered bays, beaches and untouched lands.

name: Snow in Reine Village, Lofoten Islands, Norway
desc: Reine is a fishing village and the administrative centre of the municipality of Moskenes in Nordland county, Norway. It is located on the island of Moskenesoya in the Lofoten archipelago, above the Arctic Circle, about 300 kilometres southwest of the town of Tromso.

name: Mountains of Norway
desc: The geography of Norway is dominated by vast mountain ranges broken up by valleys and fjords. Less than 10% of the country's area is arable, and the rest is mountainous.

name: Atlantic road, Norway
desc: The Atlantic Ocean Road or the Atlantic Road is an 8.3-kilometer long section of County Road 64 that runs through an archipelago in Eide and Averoy in More og Romsdal, Norway.

name: Spring sunset - Reine, Lofoten islands, Norway
desc: Reine is a fishing village and the administrative centre of the municipality of Moskenes in Nordland county, Norway. It is located on the island of Moskenesoya in the Lofoten archipelago, above the Arctic Circle, about 300 kilometres southwest of the town of Tromso.

name: Rock stuck between two mountains with cloudy sky behind in Norway
desc: The geography of Norway is dominated by vast mountain ranges broken up by valleys and fjords. Less than 10% of the country's area is arable, and the rest is mountainous.

name: Sun Star on Whitby Abbey
desc: Whitby Abbey is a ruined Benedictine abbey overlooking the North Sea on the East Cliff above Whitby in North Yorkshire, England. It was disestablished during the Dissolution of the Monasteries under the auspices of Henry VIII.

name: Big Ben and Westminster Bridge at dusk
desc: Big Ben is the nickname for the Great Bell of the clock at the north end of the Palace of Westminster in London, and often extended to refer to the clock and the clock tower.

name: The Fairy Pools, Glen Brittle, Skye, Scotland
desc: The Fairy Pools are a natural waterfall phenomenon in Glen Brittle on the Isle of Skye. The vivid blues and greens of the pools suggest an unnatural origin. They are a popular place for wild swimmers.

name: Famous Tower Bridge in the evening
desc: Tower Bridge is a combined bascule and suspension bridge in London built in 1886ï¿½1894. The bridge crosses the River Thames close to the Tower of London and has become an iconic symbol of London.

name: Stonehenge
desc: Stonehenge is a prehistoric monument in Wiltshire, England, 2 miles west of Amesbury and 8 miles north of Salisbury.

name: Twelve Apostles and orange cliffs along the Great Ocean Road
desc: The Twelve Apostles is a collection of limestone stacks off the shore of the Port Campbell National Park, by the Great Ocean Road in Victoria, Australia. Their proximity to one another has made the site a popular tourist attraction.

name: Sunset over the Hay plains in Australia
desc: Australia, officially the Commonwealth of Australia, is a country comprising the mainland of the Australian continent, the island of Tasmania, and numerous smaller islands. It is the world's sixth-largest country by total area.

name: Limestone formations
desc: Limestone is a sedimentary rock composed largely of the minerals calcite and aragonite, which are different crystal forms of calcium carbonate. Most limestone is composed of skeletal fragments of marine organisms such as coral, forams and molluscs.

name: Sun rises over the Clare Valley, South Australia
desc: Clare Valley is a valley located in South Australia about 100 kilometres north of the Adelaide city centre. It is located both within the South Australian Government region of Yorke and Mid North and the local government area of District Council of Clare and Gilbert Valleys.

name: Wonderful and beautiful underwater world with corals and tropical fish
desc: Tropical fish are generally those fish found in aquatic tropical environments around the world, including both freshwater and salt water species. Fishkeepers often keep tropical fish in freshwater and saltwater aquariums.

name: Male Ruby-throated Hummingbird with purple flowers
desc: Hummingbirds are New World birds that constitute the family Trochilidae. They are among the smallest of birds, most species measuring in the 7.5ï¿½13 cm range. Indeed, the smallest extant bird species is a hummingbird, the 5-cm bee hummingbird weighing less than a U.S. penny (2.5 g).

name: Two wolves on a rocky plateau
desc: The gray wolf or grey wolf, also known as the timber wolf or western wolf, is a canid native to the wilderness and remote areas of Eurasia and North America.

name: Majestic powerful adult red deer stag in Autumn Fall forest
desc: The red deer is one of the largest deer species. The red deer inhabits most of Europe, the Caucasus Mountains region, Asia Minor, Iran, parts of western Asia, and central Asia.

name: Amazing view of yellow tulip flowers
desc: The tulip is a Eurasian and North African genus of perennial, bulbous plants in the lily family. It is a herbaceous herb with showy flowers, of which around 75 wild species are currently accepted.

name: Oak tree in full leaf
desc: An oak is a tree or shrub in the genus Quercus of the beech family, Fagaceae. There are approximately 600 extant species of oaks.

name: Oak green young leaves in spring morning
desc: An oak is a tree or shrub in the genus Quercus of the beech family, Fagaceae. There are approximately 600 extant species of oaks.

name: Ladybug on sunflower
desc: Helianthus or sunflowers is a genus of plants comprising about 70 species in the family Compositae. The genus is one of many in the Asteraceae that are known as sunflowers.

name: Gerbera flower
desc: Gerbera is a genus of plants in the Asteraceae. It was named in honour of German botanist and medical doctor Traugott Gerber (1710-1743) who travelled extensively in Russia and was a friend of Carl Linnaeus.

name: Squirrel on a tree
desc: Squirrels are members of the family Sciuridae, consisting of small or medium-size rodents. The family includes tree squirrels, ground squirrels, chipmunks, marmots (including woodchucks), flying squirrels, and prairie dogs.

name: Single elephant walking in a road
desc: Elephants are large mammals of the family Elephantidae and the order Proboscidea. Two species are traditionally recognised, the African elephant and the Asian elephant, although some evidence suggests that African bush elephants and African forest elephants are separate species.

name: Giraffe walking in desert
desc: The giraffe is an African even-toed ungulate mammal, the tallest living terrestrial animal and the largest ruminant. Its species name refers to its camel-like shape and its leopard-like colouring.

name: Red balloons
desc: A balloon is a flexible bag that can be inflated with a gas, such as helium, hydrogen, nitrous oxide, oxygen, or air. Modern day balloons are made from materials such as rubber, latex, polychloroprene, or a nylon fabric, and can come in many colors.

name: Colorful hot air balloons flying over on Mae Ping National Park
desc: The hot air balloon is the first successful human-carrying flight technology. The first untethered manned hot air balloon flight was performed by Jean-Francois Pilatre de Rozier and Francois Laurent d'Arlandes on November 21, 1783, in Paris, France.

name: Shells on sandy beach
desc: A seashell or sea shell, also known simply as a shell, is a hard, protective outer layer created by an animal that lives in the sea. The shell is part of the body of the animal. Empty seashells are often found washed up on beaches by beachcombers.

name: Field and grass
desc: In agriculture, a field is an area of land, enclosed or otherwise, used for agricultural purposes such as cultivating crops or as a paddock or other enclosure for livestock.

name: House and village in rice terrace
desc: Mu Cang Ch?i is a rural district of Yen Bai Province, in the Northeast region of Vietnam. As of 2003, the district had a population of 42,574. The district covers an area of 1,199 km?. The district capital lies at Mu Cang Ch?i.

name: African lion
desc: The lion is one of the big cats in the genus Panthera and a member of the family Felidae. The commonly used term African lion collectively denotes the several subspecies in Africa. With some males exceeding 250 kg in weight, it is the second-largest living cat after the tiger.

name: Wild tiger
desc: The tiger is the largest cat species, most recognisable for their pattern of dark vertical stripes on reddish-orange fur with a lighter underside. The largest tigers have reached a total body length of up to 3.38 m over curves and have weighed up to 388.7 kg in the wild.

name: American Bald Eagle
desc: The bald eagle is a bird of prey found in North America. A sea eagle, it has two known subspecies and forms a species pair with the white-tailed eagle.

name: Snowboarder jumping against blue sky
desc: Snowboards are boards that are usually the width of one's foot longways, with the ability to glide on snow. Snowboards are differentiated from monoskis by the stance of the user.

name: Parachutist flying at sunset
desc: A parachute is a device used to slow the motion of an object through an atmosphere by creating drag.

name: Wheat field on the sunset
desc: Wheat is a cereal grain, originally from the Levant region of the Near East but now cultivated worldwide.

name: Birch wood in morning
desc: Birch is a thinleaved deciduous hardwood tree of the genus Betula, in the family Betulaceae, which also includes alders, hazels, and hornbeams, and is closely related to the beech/oak family, Fagaceae.

name: Beautiful romantic alley in a park with colorful trees and sunlight
desc: Autumn, also known as fall in North America, is one of the four temperate seasons. Autumn marks the transition from summer into winter.

name: Autumnal park with falling maple leaves
desc: Acer is a genus of trees or shrubs commonly known as maple. There are approximately 128 species, most of which are native to Asia, with a number also appearing in Europe, northern Africa, and North America.

name: Seljalandfoss waterfall at sunset
desc: Seljalandsfoss is one of the best known waterfalls in Iceland. Seljalandsfoss is located in the South Region in Iceland right by Route 1 and the road that leads to ?orsmork Road 249.

name: Rainbow over mountain peak
desc: A rainbow is a meteorological phenomenon that is caused by reflection, refraction and dispersion of light in water droplets resulting in a spectrum of light appearing in the sky.

name: Baikal Lake in December
desc: Lake Baikal is a rift lake in Russia, located in southern Siberia, between Irkutsk Oblast to the northwest and the Buryat Republic to the southeast.

name: Magnificent view of the Devetaki cave
desc: Devetashka cave is a huge karst cave 7 kilometers from Letnitsa and 15 km northeast of Lovech, near the village of Devetaki on the east bank of the river Osam, in Bulgaria.

name: Fantastic evening winter landscape
desc: Winter is the coldest season of the year in polar and temperate climates, between autumn and spring. Winter is caused by the axis of the Earth in that hemisphere being oriented away from the Sun.

name: Snowman on blue sky
desc: A snowman is an anthropomorphic snow sculpture often built by children in regions with sufficient snowfall. In North America, typical snowmen consist of three large snowballs of different sizes with some additional accoutrements for facial and other features.

name: Glenfinnan Railway Viaduct in Scotland
desc: Glenfinnan Viaduct is a railway viaduct on the West Highland Line in Glenfinnan, Inverness-shire, Scotland. Located at the top of Loch Shiel in the West Highlands of Scotland, the viaduct overlooks the Glenfinnan Monument and the waters of Loch Shiel.

name: Sailing into the sunset
desc: Sailing comprises wind propulsion of a craft by means of sails or other airfoils and steering it over water, ice or land, depending on the type of craft.

name: Great spotted Woodpecker perched on a birch branch
desc: The woodpeckers are part of the Picidae family, a group of near-passerine birds that also consist of piculets, wrynecks, and sapsuckers.

name: Beautiful colourful parrot
desc: Parrots, also known as psittacines, are birds of the roughly 393 species in 92 genera that make up the order Psittaciformes, found in most tropical and subtropical regions.

name: Rocky Mountain National Park Elk Herd
desc: The elk, or wapiti, is one of the largest species within the deer family, Cervidae, in the world, and one of the largest land mammals in North America and Eastern Asia.

name: Fox on stump
desc: Foxes are small-to-medium-sized, omnivorous mammals belonging to several genera of the family Canidae.

name: Field of pink roses
desc: A rose is a woody perennial flowering plant of the genus Rosa, in the family Rosaceae, or the flower it bears. There are over a hundred species and thousands of cultivars.
